title: Period of SHM - expression for spring constant

content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a horizontal spring and undergoes simple harmonic motion with frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> on a horizontal surface. Which of the following expressions is equal to the spring constant of the spring?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 pi squared, times m f squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 4 pi squared m over f squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>m</mi></mrow><msup><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="2 pi times the square root of m, end root f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mi>m</mi></msqrt><mi>f</mi></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 pi times the square root of m, and denominator f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mi>m</mi></msqrt></mrow><mi>f</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 pi squared, times m f squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
